page.title: 05TRANSPORT IN HOOK-ROAD
page.content: THE ROADS _ Mr Mustoe, a resident in Hook for many years says that the roads have stayed the same. The A30 London _ Penzance and A32 Portsmouth _ Reading intersect in the village centre. Outside Hook the M3 and a road link to the A30 at the Dorchester Arms were new in 1971. The new estates have meant new roads with a by-pass linking A32 and A30 with the northern and central sections completed.A small roundabout has been built at their intersection. The County Council will join the southern section with a tunnel under the railway when funds permit. A new roundabout in Hook centre has eased the congestion caused by the rush hour traffic from the new offices and industry in the area. The M4 motorway is also an important destination for traffic through Hook.
